1.text: Each horsegirl has different goals. \nLet's now work to realize these goals!

2.text: These are the commands that let you \nadvance through training.

3.text: Executing one command consumes a turn.

4.text: Let's go with the actual "Training" first!

5.text: These are the types of training available! \nEach one improves different capabilities.

6.text: Let's see what happens when we choose "Speed"!

7.text: Now, I want to talk to you about your \nhorsegirl's energy when training.

8.text: First, as before, let's choose a training.

9.text: Please pay attention to the "failure rate" here.

10.text: The less energy you have left, the higher the \nfailure rate will be.

11.text: Failing a training will reduce capabilities and \nmotivation so be careful…!

12.text: Now, let's get back to it.

13.text: When your horsegirl's energy is low, \nlet her take a rest to recover.

15.text: Next, choose a skill to learn. \nWe'll use the skill points you just earned!

16.text: Let's have her learn this skill for now.

18.text: And we're all set! \nLet's enter a race!

19.text: When there is a race that she can run, \nit will show up in the list.

20.text: This time, let's run in this race!

21.text: In the paddock, you can check the abilities and \nprediction rank of horsegirls running in the race!

22.text: First of all, let me explain the prediction marks. \nThe "◎", "○", "▲", and "△" marks indicate \nratings in that order, from highest to lowest.

23.text: The higher her ability and motivation, \nthe higher the expectations, and the more \nfavored a horsegirl is likely to be.

24.text: Of course, there is no guarantee of victory, but \nbroadly speaking the more favored she is, the better \nresults you can expect!

25.text: You can also change the strategy \nof your horsegirl in the paddock.

26.text: Of course choosing a strategy your \nhorsegirl is strong at is a good idea.

27.text: We're all set now! \nIt's time to run the race!!

29.text: If you have any skill points left, please don't \nforget to use them.

30.text: Well then, that's it for training!

31.text: Once a horsegirl has been trained, she will be \nevaluated based on certain criteria and then \nregistered as a "Hall of Fame Horsegirl".

32.text: Good luck in your quest for the highest rank!

33.text: Once training is complete, your horsegirl \nmay acquire a "factor".

34.text: When selecting a horsegirl as parent, her \ndesires and experiences will be passed on \nthrough their special bond as these "factors"!

35.text: Congratulations on finishing in first place!

36.text: Your horsegirl deserves lots of \npraise for her hard work!

37.text: After the race there is normally a winning live \nperformance, but since we're in the middle of \nyour introduction, let's skip that.

39.text: Although it was short in this introduction, the \nactual training period is 3 years.

40.text: Please cherish the days you spend \nwith any horsegirls in your care!

41.text: The three marks indicate the predictions of experts, \nand the expectations ranking shows the anticipation of fans.
